text: one of the lessons that the country
learned from the 9/11 attacks was that
even in a moment of great tragedy even
in a moment of great difficulty people
were able to come Together As
Americans when we were challenged when
we were assaulted we were able to turn
to each other and ask for help and the
fact that we were able to do that and we
were able to come together is one of the
greatest Testament to what it means to
be an American when historians look back
what they're going to see is that there
was a generation that emerged that
volunteered to be of service in some of
the most difficult and dangerous
environments we'd ever been presented
with this was a generation that really
worked with the courage of perseverance
it was patience that allowed the
victories that eventually came about in
Iraq it was patients that eventually
allowed us to capture Osama Bin Laden
what's uncertain yet but what we need to
see is that when this generation comes
home that they come home to actually
make our community stronger that fight
is still up in the air and that's a
fight that we still need to win we have
to live for something larger than
ourselves we all have to find a way in
our own lives to be of service to others
around us and when we do that we become
stronger and we build a stronger country
together
